intro: Cynanchum lineare subsp. keraudreniae, commonly known as the Keraudren's milkvetch, is a perennial herb native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asclepiadaceae family and is characterized by its slender, ascending stems and small, greenish-white flowers. The plant has opposite, ovate leaves with a hairy texture, and its fruit is a follicle containing several seeds. It thrives in arid or semi-arid environments and is adapted to withstand drought conditions. This subspecies is of interest in botanical studies due to its unique morphology and ecological adaptations.
